column1: Databending (or data bending) is the process of manipulating a media file of a certain format
column2: using software designed to edit files of another format. Distortions in the medium typically occur as a result
column3: and the process either falls under a broader category of
column4: or is frequently employed in glitch art.The term databending is derived from circuit bending
column5: in which objects such as children's toys
column6: effects pedals and electronic keyboards are deliberately short circuited by bending the circuit board to produce erratic and spontaneous sounds. Like circuit bending
column7: databending involves the (often unpredictable) alteration of its target's behavior. Databending achieves this alteration by manipulating the information within a media file of a certain format
column8: using software designed to edit files of a different format; distortions in the medium typically occur as a result. Many techniques exist
column9: including the use of hex editors to manipulate certain components of a compression algorithm
